column1: '''''Vinyar Tengwar''''' is a linguistic journal published by the [[Elvish Linguistic Fellowship]]
column2: dedicated to the scholarly study of the invented languages of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

column1: ''"Vinyar Tengwar"'' is ''Dog-[[Quenya]]'' for "News Letters". ''Vinyar'' is the plural of ''[[vinya]]''
column3: and ''[[Tengwar]]'' means "letters". Despite the incorrectness of the title
column4: it was kept for old times' sake and also because the correct form proposed to replace it

column2: at first edited by [[Jorge Quiñonez]] and later taken over by [[Carl F. Hostetter]]. It appeared  in bimonthly intervals at first
column5: roughly once a year. This coincided with the greater frequency of publication of texts written by Tolkien himself; the journal is now dedicated primarily to such texts. Several of these texts were mentioned in volumes of ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]''
column7: but not published in that series owing to their specialist or recondite nature.

column1: Back issues of the journal are now available for all issues
column2: and published in collections of ten issues on a per-order basis.

column1: <div style="-moz-column-width: 250px; -webkit-column-width: 250px; column-width: 250px; -moz-column-gap: 15px; -webkit-column-gap: 15px; column-gap: 15px; -webkit-column-rule: 1px solid #cccccc; -moz-column-rule: 1px solid #cccccc; column-rule: 1px solid #cccccc;">

column2: which lists the contents of each issue of VT and provides ordering information]
